channel.title: Howto on Thomas Chester's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Howto on Thomas Chester's Blog

item.title: Using the bpod Gem
item.description: This post will discuss installing the bpod gem on a macOS desktop and then scheduling it to change your desktop picture each day to the Bing home page image.

item.title: Palindromic Prime Calculation
item.description: This post will dicuss palindromic prime numbers using ruby code. It will also discuss several refinements made to the original attempt to speed up the performance.

item.title: MySQL Backups with AutoMySQLBackup
item.description: This walk-through will describe how to configure AutoMySQLBackup to perform scheduled backups of a MySQL database and then use rsync to make a redundant copy to another computer.

item.title: Installing ownCloud on ArchLinux
item.description: Do you like the idea of DropBox but want to host the files on a server that you control. This how-to will walkthrough installing ownCloud on an ArchLinux installation and then configuring a Mac client to sync with it.

item.title: Setup an ArchLinux System
item.description: This walk-through will focus on a fresh installation of ArchLinux on a HP Envy TouchSmart SE all-in-one computer. The all-in-one has an existing installation of Windows 8.1 that will be replaced.

item.title: Installing an IPFire Based Firewall
item.description: In this post I will discuss setting up an IPFire based firewall appliance via a console serial cable.

item.title: How To Add Drivers to a Windows Deployment Image
item.description: This post describes the procedure for opening a Windows image and incorporating vendor specific drivers in it for the purposes of deploying that image on new equipment.

item.title: SSIS Multi-Environment Configration
item.description: This post describes a method of managing multiple SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) package configurations across environments using a single SQL Server table.

item.title: How To Upgrade Windows Server 2008 from Standard Edition to Datacenter Edition
item.description: This post describes a process for upgrading a Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard edition to the Datacenter edition using generic Key Management Server (KMS) keys.

item.title: How To Source Control Your SQL Server Databases
item.description: This document discusses the feasibility of using source control with database development for SQL Server (2005 and newer) databases.
